## What is Git

Version control system

- manage different versions of files
- collaborate with yourself
- collaborate with other people

![](https://git-scm.com/images/logos/1color-orange-lightbg@2x.png)

## Git tracks versions like a stream of snapshots

![Storing data as snapshots of the project over time. Source: Pro Git by Scott Chacon & Ben Straub](https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/images/snapshots.png)

## Git is a distributed system

![One advantage of a distributed version control system is that there are many copies of the repository. Thus, if any server or computer dies, any of the client repositories can be copied and used to restore the data! Every clone (or fork) is a full backup of all the data. Source: Pro Git by Scott Chacon & Ben Straub](https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/book/01-introduction/images/distributed.png)
